texts.value: ATP-gated nonselective transmembrane cation channel permeable to potassium, sodium and calcium (PubMed:10440098, PubMed:8961184, PubMed:9119082). Activation by extracellular ATP induces a variety of cellular responses, such as excitatory postsynaptic responses in sensory neurons, neuromuscular junctions (NMJ) formation, hearing, perception of taste and peristalsis. In the inner ear, regulates sound transduction and auditory neurotransmission, outer hair cell electromotility, inner ear gap junctions, and K(+) recycling. Mediates synaptic transmission between neurons and from neurons to smooth muscle (By similarity)

Fast activation by external ATP (PubMed:10440098, PubMed:9119082). Exhibits slow desensitization during prolonged ATP activation (PubMed:10440098, PubMed:9119082). Not sensitive to the ATP agonist:alpha/beta-methylene-ATP (By similarity)

Homotrimer and heterotrimer; functional P2XRs are organized as homomeric and heteromeric trimers (PubMed:11181939, PubMed:15313628). Homotrimer (PubMed:15313628). Forms heterotrimer with P2RX1 (PubMed:15313628). Forms heterotrimer with P2RX6 (PubMed:17449665). Forms heterotrimer with P2RX3 (PubMed:11181939)
High levels in pituitary and vas deferens. Lower extent in spinal cord, bladder, brain, adrenal, testis, sensory epithelia from the inner ear
Belongs to the P2X receptor family

citation.title: New structural motif for ligand-gated ion channels defined by an ionotropic ATP receptor.
Desensitization of the P2X(2) receptor controlled by alternative splicing.
Identification of a short form of the P2xR1-purinoceptor subunit produced by alternative splicing in the pituitary and cochlea.
Ionic permeability of, and divalent cation effects on, two ATP-gated cation channels (P2X receptors) expressed in mammalian cells.

Coexpression of P2X(3) and P2X(2) receptor subunits in varying amounts generates heterogeneous populations of P2X receptors that evoke a spectrum of agonist responses comparable to that seen in sensory neurons.
Pharmacological characterization of recombinant human and rat P2X receptor subtypes.
Intracellular disulfide bond that affects ATP responsiveness of P2X(2) receptor/channel.
Trimeric architecture of homomeric P2X2 and heteromeric P2X1+2 receptor subtypes.
The stoichiometry of P2X2/6 receptor heteromers depends on relative subunit expression levels.

properties.value: the atp-gated p2x receptor cation channel (p2x receptor) family
Expressed in testis and 16 other cell types or tissues
C:parallel fiber to Purkinje cell synapse
F:extracellularly ATP-gated monoatomic cation channel activity
P:detection of hypoxic conditions in blood by carotid body chemoreceptor signaling
P:regulation of presynaptic cytosolic calcium ion concentration
